ygData.subject: Re: Monk Tinking
ygData.msgSnippet: Here is my 2 cp - I would have to agree that speed twinking really kills. I had a (now previous) character that was given a box of Quest item belts to return
ygData.messageBody:
Here is my 2 cp - I would have to agree that speed twinking really kills.

I had a (now previous) character that was given a box of "Quest item" belts
to return to "someone" for experience, cash and a minor (sellable) item.
Well, with this first level character, it was an instant jump to level 4
with enough csh left over to buy some leather.

Great. Instant level 4 and plenty of skill points to play with. Not by
half. I have since abandoned the character because he can't pull his own
weight in combat or spells as his skills are way underdeveloped and a
monster that /cons blue still whups him hard enough that he has to sit for
20 minutes to regain hp & mana.

My new character is less than a week (RL) old, nearly reached level 7,
hasn't twinked a thing and really kicks ass.

I wouldn't recommend speed twinking to anyone.

Genane
Cazic Thule



----- Original Message -----
From: Imari J. A. Dellimore <ijad@...>
To: <EQ-Monks@onelist.com>
Sent: Wednesday, 15 September 1999 8:24
Subject: Re: [EQ-Monks] Monk Tinking


> From: "Imari J. A. Dellimore" <ijad@...>
>
> Probably just you?
> Not sure how you got your monk to level 4 with only 6 H2H, but I suppose
> if youy hunted in groups it was possible. Certainly by time youy hit mid
> levels like 10+ you max out skills within the first buble of a new level.
> Skills are never a worry for me.
>
> On Wed, 15 Sep 1999, David Saunders wrote:
>
> > From: "David Saunders" <abitar@...>
> >
> > Only thing twinking does to me ( I assume other too) Make the game
boring
> > and soon forgotten.
> >
> > I found that if I use cheat codes or twink I soon loose interest in the
> > chalange of the moment.
> >
> > For the same reason I dislike begger and those who consitly ask for a
hand
> > out.
> >
> > Life is a hard life for a monk, give thanks for the things that pass by
your
> > way. To level with ggreat speed, is that hurting you more then not?
> >
> > The qustion is, If a person Speed Levels( very quick EXPS) will his
skills
> > keep up, or will they lag behind?
> >
> > I had a monk who whent to level 4 very quicky and only had H2H of 6 and
Kick
> > of 7, Was that just me or does speed kill?
> >
> > Towshee of the many servers
